== Open Options: Remix Computing with Open Source Software (event at Millersville University) ==

=== About ===

<nowiki>[[http://www.millersville.edu/|Millersville University]]</nowiki> in Millersville (near Lancaster) is hosting an event called ''Open Options: Remix Computing with Open Source Software''.

The event is designed to introduce students and faculty to the concept and philosophy of open source software. It will consist of approximately a 1 hour round table discussion on Open Source and approximately 1 hour of casual demonstrations, discussion and questions (think: tables with demos, people wandering around, cookies, coffee, chat).

More detail about this event is being discussed on the mailing list, starting with this post: <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-us-pa/2009-December/000920.html]]</nowiki>, you can also contribute to discussion on the forum: <nowiki>[[http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1349629]]</nowiki>

The Ubuntu Pennsylvania team has been invited to participate by:

# Participating in the roundtable
# Doing F/OSS software demos
# Other ideas?

Contact Bryan Behrenshausen, Department of Communication & Theatre, Millersville University (behrenshausen -AT- gmail -DOT- com) directly if you're interested in participating in the roundtable.

See below to sign up for demonstrations or email <nowiki>[[lyz|Elizabeth Krumbach]]</nowiki> at lyz@ubuntu.com

=== Date, Time and Location ===

 {*} '''Date''': Thursday, February 18, 2010

 {*} '''Time''': 7-9PM (may run later, depending on attendee questions and interest)

 {*} '''Location''': <nowiki>[[http://www.library.millersville.edu//|Millersville University's Ganser Library]]</nowiki>, 4th floor

=== Demonstration ideas ===

* Photo editing software (gimp, inkscape)
* IM software (empathy, pidgin)
* Music management software
* Torrenting software
* Office software (maybe include Crossover options?)
* Applications running under WINE
* The Android platform
* Discuss the Software Center (thousands of free applications for free)
